content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
I attempted to activate conda and run a Python script using different paths, but all returned error messages indicating that the necessary files were not found. In my latest development, I tried multiple paths to activate conda and run the script, but all returned error messages indicating that the necessary files were not found. Specifically, I tried to activate conda using paths such as /opt/miniconda3/etc/profile.d/conda.sh, ~/anaconda3/etc/profile.d/conda.sh, /home/katmai/anaconda3/bin/activate, /home/katmai/anaconda3/etc/profile.d/conda.sh, /home/katmai/miniconda3/etc/profile.d/conda.sh, and /opt/conda/bin/activate, but all returned errors stating that the necessary files were not found. I received an AI response to execute_shell with the command to source /opt/miniconda3/etc/profile.d/conda.sh and activate arcgis, but the action_result returned a "No such file or directory" error. The same error occurred when I tried to activate conda using the paths ~/anaconda3/etc/profile.d/conda.sh, /home/katmai/anaconda3/bin/activate, /home/katmai/miniconda3/etc/profile.d/conda.sh, and /home/katmai/anaconda3/bin/activate. Finally, I received an AI response to execute_shell with the command to source /opt/conda/bin/activate and activate arcgis, but the action_result returned a "No such file or directory" error.
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "execute_shell", "args": {"command_line": "bash -c 'source /opt/anaconda3/etc/profile.d/conda.sh && conda activate arcgis && echo \"Environment activated.\"'"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "execute_shell", "args": {"command_line": "bash -c 'source /opt/anaconda3/bin/activate && conda activate arcgis && echo \"Environment activated.\"'"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "execute_shell", "args": {"command_line": "bash -c 'source /home/atlas/anaconda3/bin/activate && conda activate arcgis && echo \"Environment activated.\"'"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content="Command execute_shell returned: STDOUT:
